TopicTitle: [.23+] Jeb and Bill 9000, a smaller radial Jeb for the Clarke fans.

Articles.Content: MechJeb GUI doesn't pop up for either of them in game for me, any ideas?

Kethane, Novapunch, or Hydrotech tends to interfere with the GUI in my opinion. Sorry.

Either that or you did not download the 2.0.7 version of mechjeb.
I have no idea. Try reinstalling the most recent Mj2 plugin? I can't recreate that bug.

Where can I get the old Jeb 9000 that runs with Jeb 1.9.x?

Thanks.

- George
Jeb 9000 is included in the download. Both are available in that same zip. I'll try to set up spaceport again, but it keeps eating my post...

Sadly your brilliant Jeb and Bill 9000 doesn't work for 0.20.

Any chance for an update?

Sadly your brilliant Jeb and Bill 9000 doesn't work for 0.20.

Any chance for an update?

.dae are broken, yet another undocumented 0.20 change.

Should be easy to convert to .mu

In case Dishy is not around for a few days and you absolutely must have your BillJeb 9000 fix, here is my personal .mu and 0.20 conversion:

mediafire

Dishy, here's the unity sources for that:

mediafire

I might suggest shrinking the texture to 512x for a future release, the names will still be readable, its a little large right now

P.S. The parts are also rotated so if you stick them to the front of a rocket with the text right-side up, or similar for a plane, the horizon is correct when you do 'control from here'.

Edited May 23, 2013 by Taverius
It works for me, other than the texture missing. But I fixed that by renaming the "Textures" directory in the part's directory to "textures".

In case Dishy is not around for a few days and you absolutely must have your BillJeb 9000 fix, here is my personal .mu and 0.20 conversion:

mediafire

Dishy, here's the unity sources for that:

mediafire

I might suggest shrinking the texture to 512x for a future release, the names will still be readable, its a little large right now

P.S. The parts are also rotated so if you stick them to the front of a rocket with the text right-side up, or similar for a plane, the horizon is correct when you do 'control from here'.

Much appreciated change here! I haven't even been able to fire up .20 yet. I didn't know it breaks dae's, which is really unfortunate for the older-parts I've been updating for my own game. I'll incorporate all of the changes in the next release. Summer break, so it shouldn't be too far off. I haven't been able to get into unity yet, but it's installed, etc. I'll need to read up.

My textures usually are pretty large. I can shrink them or compress them a bit without a lot of loss. Give me a few days and I'll update this and the ball probe. Spertnik is dead for the time being, but may see a revival in the future.

I have been trying to hand everything over to sixteenbit, but he hasn't been around as much with the summer break. Hopefully, we can work something out soon.
finaly found it!

It works for me, other than the texture missing. But I fixed that by renaming the "Textures" directory in the part's directory to "textures".

Thanks for this! Worked like a charm.
Is there a good way to replace all the JEB 9000 units on all the ships in a persistence file with BILL 9000 units?
Or can I just alter the JEB 9000 cfg file so that it will link the parts to MechJeb 2 instead of MechJeb 1?

Ok... So I went ahead and put the Bill9000 cfg file into the JEB9000 folder, then edited all the Bills in the cfg file to JEBs or Jebs (making sure to keep the proper capitalizations)......and the huge number of spacecraft I have spread around the solar system now seem to properly call up MechJeb 2.08. So I guess this worked. Hopefully nothing is going to come along later and bite me on the ass from this.

Now I need to figure out how to use this new version of MechJeb.
so is this up to 2.08?
Bill9000 is. Jeb9000 is for 1.9.8.

Bill9000 is. Jeb9000 is for 1.9.8.

This. I haven't had the time to figure out why my steam-delivered copy of KSP crashes on load. I have to get mechjeb working before I can get these parts working. No release date, but at some point.

Being an adult is not as fun as I was told it would be.
Updated- Finally: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/jeb9000-and-bill9000-small-radial-jebs-2/

EDIT: (Was about to suggest three-letter acronym when I found this)

HAL : IBM : JEB : ???

Continuity would actually suggest BIL 9000. One "L"...

On the other hand, continuity would also suggest a name starting with "K".

Edited July 27, 2013 by Corax
condensed quote

Continuity would actually suggest BIL 9000. One "L"...

On the other hand, continuity would also suggest a name starting with "K".

HAL:IBM::JEB:KFC Our Kerbals are little fried chickens! ;-)

HAL:IBM::JEB:KFC Our Kerbals are little fried chickens! ;-)

Yes, that is quite obvious. I was serious about BIL though... I think it'd look much nicer, and as I said, for "authenticity's" sake.

Edited July 27, 2013 by Corax
So GLaD this is updated! One of my favourite parts, because of it's size and design
Give this man some punnicillin!

The Bill version seems to work fine, but the Jeb version causes problems in the VAB with 0.21.1... Clicking on it from the parts menu brings up an old-style MJ window with vessel info, it cannot be closed. Cashing in the part makes the VAB look like it's back to normal, but then you can't click on anything (even menu buttons). Even changing the Jeb-9000 part config so that all values are the same as Bill-9000 doesn't fix it.

Essentially I just use the Bill part then. Not that there's any difference except appearance... nor should there be of course.
